meanings.definition: To divide or separate into sects or factions based on religious or political beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The preacher was sectarianizing the congregation by emphasizing their differences.
meanings.sent2: The politician's divisive rhetoric was sectarianizing the community.
meanings.sent3: The debate team jokingly accused their captain of sectarianizing them into opposing groups.
meanings.sent4: The heated discussion was sectarianizing the once-united neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict seating arrangement was sectarianizing the students, creating distinct groups.

meanings.definition: To promote or incite sectarian divisions or conflicts.
meanings.sent1: The inflammatory speech was sectarianizing the listeners, stirring up animosity.
meanings.sent2: The extremist group was actively sectarianizing the population, fueling hatred.
meanings.sent3: The prankster pretended to be sectarianizing the party, causing playful disagreements.
meanings.sent4: The rumors were sectarianizing the workplace, leading to tension among colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The online posts were sectarianizing the online community, sparking heated debates.
